reviews.review: Great open world RPG, do what you want how you want. Very enjoyable weapon system. Magic system could use some work, but I hear the sequel is even better.

So I've been playing this intensly for the past week or so. Initially I started playing as I've found out that I had gotten this and Two Wolds II from a sale and (obviously) I have to go through the first one before starting the II. What I've found is:

Nice:
- Cool system of combining same kinds of gear to upgrade them (no skill required). 4 katanas in you inventory? combine them  to a single thicc nippon steel  bad boi. Better gear and less space neede in inventory
- Nice dialogue and Story execution. The interaction and dialogoues with NPCs during quests is nicely thought out and quite extensive (if you're into that)
- Massive selection of different gear sets
- Good combat balance. Never felt too OP unless venturing into high-level territory.
- Factions with different pros and cons

Meh:
- Soft locks for some quests that get cancelled after doing other, seemingly unrelated quests
- MASSIVE juddering and stuttering. No matter what you specs are. but you get used to it
- Too hard to find a fitting set. I'm at level 57 now and still collecting gear to complete a set that makes sense and is stronger than the stuff I've been combining for 57 levels
- Some items don't combine although they seem like they should
- Selling is tedious. No easier way than drag n drop or double click every item
- Voice acting. Dialogue (as said) would be nice but sometimes the voice acting gets in the way.
- Story is somewhat basic
- You can up your reputation in contrasting factions with almost no consequences. doesn't really make sense

Overall really nice game. Deffo worth it.
Weites offenes Land mit vielen Keilereien. Besonders Skillsystem und Aufrüstung sind gut.
несмотря на все свои косяки, игра очень сильно затягивает
Very good game, if yu are a hardcore gamer. I enjoyed Oblivon, Gothic 3 and this game got some of this and some of that and some of Daggerfall.

Старая топорная РПГ с интересной историей и большим живым миром.
Плюсы игры:
+Соулс лайк до самого соус лайка
+Огромное количество лута
+более 100 различных заклятий 
+Очень сильные противники
+Много квестов как интересных и серьёзных, так и смешных
+Заточка сетов простая и податливая 
+Много разных локаций
+Карта бесшовная

Минусы:
-Топорная механика боя
-плохая оптимизация
-скудные модельки существ
-неоправданно сильные боссы и непись
-ОЧЕНЬ МАЛО ЛОШАДЕЙ В МИРЕ!

Итог:
Сюжет 7/10
Механика 4/10
Квесты 8/10
Наполняемость мира 6/10
Инвентарь и лут 9/10
Магия 8/10
Непись как источник информации 8/10
Непись как противник 10/10

Оценка игры ---------7,2/10

ever had a game crash on you because you alt tabbed? how about crashing because you tried to save. this game is a nightmare of issues, ranging from the aforementioned crashing problems to vsync issues to frame drops. your money is better spent paying someone to punch you in the face.

Didn't age well, but it has a certain charm to it, so i like it very much. The main argument for this game is the "talking" main character vs the "silent" main character in TES games, which gives it a different athmosphere.
Main story isnt that gripping, but the lore and individual NPCs are very charming.

Игра хорошая

Oubliez donc vos Watch Dogs 3 et autre CyberPunk. Vous avez ici la quintessence du RPG. 

Au niveau gameplay : 
- Une réactivité et une intensité folle. 
- Des dialogues en plein combat du style "oh" "ah" "ouille" ou autres "aie" 
- Une violence des coups critiques qui en ferait palir le plus féroce des corps à corps. 
- Des monstres incontestables uniques. 
Au niveau OST : 
- Plongez au coeur d'un original soudtrack qui a inspirer IRON ZUR et JEREMY SOULS
-Une ambiance magique et enivrante. 
- des bruitages fait par le maitre incontesté dans le milieu : Jean Michel Bruitage. 

Un monde ouvert féérique, aussi grand que les AAA de RPG et qui plus est, a une suite! 
Foncez découvrir cette pépite qu'est Two Worlds.

This game is a hidden gem. The voice acting is mediocre most times and good at some times and the dialogue is cringe-inducing with just enough professionalism to make you at least feel a little immersed. For an old game, it looks great. I remember playing on the 360 and facing relentless lag, but on the PC it's a good time. The gameplay is a lot like an elder scrolls game combined with maybe champions of Norath if you know what that is. There are many different types of creatures, even original ones you won't find in other games. There are factions, though there aren't a load of interactions with them aside from just doing quests to get the rep for them; they're mostly just parts of the environment and role play I suppose. There is potion crafting and ingredients. It's really just everything I look for in a retro rpg. It's super cheesy. Honestly... 10/10. You should definitely check this game out.

Two Worlds si può definire il "cugino brutto" di The Elder Scrolls.
Tante sono le idee buone di questo gioco: il sistema di reputazione, armi inusuali da giocare (lance, bombe e trappole), missioni e ambienti molto variegati tra loro... Tuttavia tutte queste idee non trovano una buona applicazione nel concreto.
Lasciando da parte trama e ambientazione che, seppur con qualche originalità, ricalcano molto i classici del fantasy, il gioco è colmo di problemi, bug e brutte realizzazioni, che a lungo andare diventano pesanti in un gioco di ruolo che ha bisogno di moltissime ore per essere goduto appieno. I movimenti solo legnosi, i cavalli si bloccano con poco dislivello del terreno, i combattimenti sono brutti da vedere e scattosi (nonostante le buone animazioni delle armi).
L'ambientazioni è a tratti bella e a tratti spoglia, vuota. Le città sono molto diverse tra loro, ma le campagne sono vuote o monotone, con alcuni gruppi di nemici che spawnano ogni tot metri. Le missioni sembrano molto diversificate, ma alla fine risultano sempre nel trovare un nemico a caso nella mappa e farlo fuori.
Il gioco è in generale passa da una fase iniziale di divertimento, nello scoprire le varie caratteristiche, ad una noia e tediosità mortale, dimostrando che il gioco sembra quasi "incompleto" nell'affinamento delle meccaniche, con tanti buchi o problemi che sembrano dovuti a una noncuranza dei programmatori (o ad una fretta di rilascio).
Giusto la colonna sonora è particolarmente bella, soprattutto il tema del menù principale (creata tra l'altro dagli Ambermoon, band italiana di gran valore ma da anni sciolta).
In generale non consiglio il gioco se cercate un buon gioco di ruolo che vi prenda dall'inizio alla fine, ma se vi incuriosisce vi consiglio di comprarlo con forti sconti a pochi euro.

Ээээх... Игра детства... Вроде бы уже дважды проходил, два года назад аж целиком зачистил и уже думал все, ан нет опять настольная тянет, хз почему... Плюсы на 2020 я выделить из этой игры для новых игроков уже не смогу, разве что побродить, поизучать олдскульный мир под спокойную музыку) Сложности в игре как таковой нет, боевая механика сильно устарела, быстро приестся... Ребят! Кто займётся ремейком и полной переработкой боевой системы? Так же можно и мир доработать) Восточная часть карты от реки скудновата, да и к гномам в горы я всегда очень хотел сходить, даже через баги пытался пролезть в этот запрещённый город, хоть там и только голые стены... Я требую РЕМЕЙКА!
i've played this game for 1000+ hour back on my old xbox 360, and i'm looking forward to playing more again. if you like skyrim you'll like two worlds.

Two Worlds Epic Edition
1. von 3. RPG von 2009.

In Europa im Mai 2007 von Zuxxez Entertainment veröffentlicht, in den USA vier Monate später von TopWare Interactive. Die hier vorliegende Version ist wohl eine übersetzte US Version. Ich habe alle 3 gespielt, von daher ist das nachfolgende also zutreffend für alle Versionen.

Du schlüpft`s in die Rolle eines namenlosen jungen Kopfgeldjägers, dessen Schwester Kira von einem Bösewicht namens Reist entführt wurde. Nach monatelanger vergeblicher Suche wirst du von Reist Tungard kontaktiert. Im Spiel sind etliche Videosequenzen die dir das Wissen vermitteln worum es eigentlich geht und was denn dein eigentliches Ziel ist. 
In diesem Fall die Befreiung des Kriegsgottes Aziraal.  Du gerätst dadurch in den Machtkampf zwischen längst vergessenen Göttern.
Die Welt Antaloor ist riesig, 60 km² groß dies teilt sich auf in 35 km² Oberwelt und 25 km² Unterwelt. Es gibt fünf große Städte und über 50 Dörfer sowie zahlreiche Höhlen und andere versteckte Orte. Der RPG Gedanke zeigt sich deutlich in dem du wirklich viele verschiedene Aufgaben lösen mußt und deinen Charakter weiterentwickeln kannst. 

Für all jene ein Tipp die gerne der Haupthandlung hinterher rennen. Wenn ihr das tut werdet ihr nur ein Bruchteil dessen erspielen was dieses ausgesprochen gute Spiel bietet. Und keine Sorge du wirst deine Schwester schon finden und auch befreien, sie ist ja gefangen und läuft dir nicht weg.  Mit der Befreiung endet das Spiel.

Hinweis: Es gibt ein Bug im Spiel der auch nie behoben wurde. Du sollst den Alphawolf eines Rudels finden und unschädlich machen.
Der Ort ist oberhalb eines Felsens, dieser Felsen ist das Problem da sich der Wolf gerne mal in diesen Felsen zurückzieht, wo ihr ihn nicht erreichen könnt. Also vorher Speichern und gegebenenfalls öfters probieren. Ihr müsst ihn vom Felsen weg treiben, sonnst bleibt er im Felsen und kommt auch nicht mehr raus.   

Seinerzeit eine Sensation in Sachen Landschaftsgrafik und noch immer besser als viele die deutlich neuer sind, aber sie ist halt schon alt. 
TW konzentriert sich auf upgrad von Waffen, Schilden und Rüstungen. Die schiere Menge an Möglichkeiten ist ein Novum in der Spielgeschichte. Von daher solltet ihr euch genau überlegen was, wann und welche Teile ihr aufwertet. Die Schwierigkeit dabei ist das auch schwächere Teile eine bessere Wahl sein können da sie weiter als die Starken aufgerüstet werden können. Die richtige Ausrüstung zu haben ist das entscheidende in diesem Spiel. 

Ein richtig gutes RPG mit viel Handlung, lupenreine Empfehlung.

Two Worlds Epic Edition
1st of 3rd RPG of 2009.

Published in Europe in May 2007 by Zuxxez Entertainment, in the US four months later by TopWare Interactive. The version available here is probably a translated US version. I've played all 3, so the following applies to all versions.

You slip into the role of a nameless young bounty hunter whose sister Kira was kidnapped by a villain named Reist. After months of searching in vain, you will be contacted by Reist Tungard. In the game there are several video sequences that give you the knowledge what it is actually about and what your actual goal is.
In this case, the liberation of Aziraal, god of war. This puts you in a power struggle between long-forgotten gods.
The world of Antaloor is huge, 60 km² in size, which is divided into 35 km² of the upper world and 25 km² of the underworld. There are five large cities and over 50 villages as well as numerous caves and other hidden places. The RPG idea shows itself clearly in that you really have to solve many different tasks and can develop your character further.

A tip for all those who like to chase after the main story. If you do that, I will only earn a fraction of what this very good game offers. And don't worry, you'll find your sister and free her too, she's trapped and won't run away from you. The game ends with the liberation.

Note: There is a bug in the game that has never been fixed. You should find the alpha wolf of a pack and make it harmless.
The place is above a rock, this rock is the problem because the wolf likes to retreat into this rock where you cannot reach it. So save beforehand and try more often if necessary. You have to drive it away from the rock, otherwise it stays in the rock and does not come out.

At the time a sensation in terms of landscape graphics and still better than many who are much newer, but it's just old.
TW focuses on upgrading weapons, shields and armor. The sheer amount of possibilities is a first in game history. Therefore, you should think carefully about what, when and which parts you upgrade. The difficulty here is that even weaker parts can be a better choice because they can be upgraded further than the strong ones. Having the right equipment is crucial in this game.

A really good RPG with a lot of action, a flawless recommendation.

I enjoy this game. Combat is simple and straight forward. I fight with a bow and magic. Firewall is a good early spell that distracts packs of wolves, giving you time to overdraw your bow. Horses are fun ways to travel the map. 

All enemies stay dead so you can clear the map. However with no life, it looks barren, so I leave all small mammals and snakes alone. You can go anywhere in any order with the large open map. Certainly some areas are off limits because the foes are too strong early game. 

Duals with other bowmen are fun. You just have to draw and release quicker then they do, cause the shock of getting hit will throw off their shot. Its a fun game to juts hang out in and explore. I actually like the old English dialogue with 'Mayhap you could aid us'  type wording. Unlike  like many RPG's  the bulk of dialogue is spoken. Graphics are average for 2009 with the weakest spot being the face textures. It has a sort of quirkiness to it that I enjoy.
This game is a very fun RPG which I am way too addicted to.

Das spiel macht sehr viel Spaß. Die Haupt Story ist zwar sehr dünn und nicht wirklich mitreißend aber durch die riesige und detallierte Spielwelt ist das nicht wirklich schlimm. Es fühlt sich an wie eine Mischung aus Gothic 3 und Oblivion. Was den Spielspaß am leben hält sind die unzähligen neben Quests die wirklich sehr abwechslungsreich gestaltet sind. Die größte schwäche des Spiels sind aber die vielen KI Probleme und die sehr dünne und langweilige Haupthandlung. Dennoch ein gutes Rollenspiel. 8/10P

This was a good game - there were undoubtedly some weaknesses to it that keep it from being great, but over all it provided a significant amount of entertainment time... we bought this on sale for $2... got 160 hours of play time out of it - hard to beat that.

I played only the single player game.

Things I didn't like about the game:
(1) It wasn't very well balanced - that is it felt nearly impossible at the beginning and at the end the "big" battles were incredibly disappointing... 2 hits and done. This may have been due to my play style - which is to do every side task as it comes along and build the character / gear up - so in the end at nearly level 100 with maxed gear, nothing was a challenge.

(2) The story line gets lost in all the noise of the side tasks that involve you in a lot of politics and seemingly "important" decisions that really mean nothing to the actual story line. To be clear if you step back from the tasks and attempt to go straight to "saving your sister" the game is likely to present a harder experience start to finish and the story line is likely to be better served.

Things I liked about the game:
(1) The "open world" feel to it that really didn't restrict you from taking whatever path you wanted to through the stories and the landscape.

(2) The world - it felt consistent and presented in a great deal of detail. The side quests seemed important to the NPCs involved in them and could suck you in with their detail and intrigue. Plus I just really liked the way it looked.

(3) The crafting system of stacking like named items - at first this wasn't overly obvious as the key to real development, but once you figure out what is going on you can get very strong very quickly. The potions were also a nice touch and critical to getting strong in the game.

Hints on playing the game.
You will start out very weak... get a two handed pike type weapon as soon as you can and learn to keep things at arms length by jumping back. eventually the battle rhythms will become clear.

Everything "stacks" and gets better - start stacking early... this includes magic. 

Magic seemed to be very under powered for the game... in the end we had "bolts" that were stacked 150 deep with maxed "boosts" and they still only did a tiny fraction of the damage a single sword hit would do. The one exception was the reflective shield earth magic... reflecting 80% or more of the damage received turns you in to a tank that no longer has to dodge. Found fire area spell to be fun in keeping things distracted while you beat on them

Use the horse as a chest - no matter what the hype, fighting from horse back is no fun and the critter can't climb hills of which the world is full and he dies with a single stray arrow if he is near a battle and you aren't on him.

Get to the first big town as quickly as you can and learn alchemy - making potions is the only way to be successful in the game long term.

The control button is your friend when it comes to the game of inventory tetris... of which there is a large amount of in the game with all the different alchemy parts etc... CTRL allows you to move/use/sell/drop a stack of items rather individual items.

I like the freedom to roam as well as be involved in the quests. You're not obliged to follow a strict line. Skills are developed sensibly so you don't get overpowered too soon and hence lose the challenge of enemies who get tougher as you progress through different regions. Strategy and cunning are as important as brute strength. The controls can take a while to get used to but the manual tells you all you need to know. The horses are a great asset in open spaces at full gallop - you can floor enemies with a well timed weapon swipe. Choose the type of weapon to suit the enemy. On the downside, horse can get stroppy in combat when there's not much wriggle room, and not go where you want it to, so some combat is best on foot. There's a lot to learn in the game, all good, and well worth the effort.

I shouldn't like this game. Everything is bad. EVERYTHING. From the soul destroying dialogue recorded in a construction site Port-A-John to the eye bleeding lighting....buuut something about slapping together the identical weapons and armor has carried me through 3 playthroughs. Two on the 360. 

It ran well until the end, I had to watch the ending cut scenes on YouTube. After beating the boss it would boot me to the loading screen. Alt-tab out of fullscreen would crash the game 50 percent of the time. 

10/10 fun bad. Pray tell, verily purchase on sale.

This wasn't bad, per se, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. The voice acting and writing are genuinely awful. The sound design is amateurish at best. The world itself is a generic fantasy world with very few redeeming qualities. It is too large with far too few things to find in it. Animations take too long. There are lots of bugs, including one that randomly shot my player high into the air.

At least the graphics are adequate for the era (May 2007). The faces look better than The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion, at least. Nothing else about it is better, though.

Overall, it's a forgettable, generic RPG that appears to have been made by a development team who reached beyond their grasp.

[u] BEFORE YOU BUY THIS GAME [/u]
I saw this on sale for 3.99, and after playing it back in the day (back on Xbox 360 when it first came out) I figured, "Why the hell not?"
Boy, what a mistake that was.

If you're looking to play single player, then by all means go for it and spend your money.
[b] However, [/b] if you're looking to play online, like the rest of us OG's, well you're sh!t outta luck.
ALL official servers are DOWN. You cannot use Hamachi, Tunngle, or Evolve to create a server for you and your friends.

Refunded this the moment I figured out online servers were officially down.
And before you ask; No, you CANNOT play via LAN.

I think the developers should put a notice, or at least STEAM should update the game features and list the game as SINGLE PLAYER ONLY, as it is VERY misleading and it's technically false advertising.
[spoiler] I figure that due to the servers being closed for good, it's probably the reason why it's on sale. [/spoiler]

Per my past experience (when the game first came out) the single player experience was terrible, but the online is what made this game amazing (at least for me).
Now that it has no online, it's just an uncompleted and buggy RPG.

Please upvote this review, so that others who are looking to play online can see this review before making the same mistake that I did.

Two Worlds... Where to begin? Do I recommend it? Yes, but only if you're willing to put up with a few things!

So originally I had this game on Xbox 360. I never played it properly for the story, I just kinda ran around, killed people and got weapons which is perfectly fine!
It wasn't until I picked it up again on Steam that I wanted to give it a proper go. I decided to follow the campaign and also complete quests whenever I got them and I have to say I had a lot of fun doing so!
Despite its flaws, Two Worlds is a relatively immersive game. It's not as in-depth as many other fantasy RPGs with their multi-skill levelling and a plethora of crafting to be had. That being said, it lends itself to its own beauty. It's not an amazingly flashy game and there are quite a few bugs. But there's something about this game that I absolutely love.
It might be the painfully awful voice acting that has this quirk to it that I enjoy, or it might just be the simplicity of a game that doesn't require you to grind at one particular school of combat or magic to be good at. 
Everything is quite easily accessible, and if following the quests, you can pick up a lot of useful skills and also XP to level faster!
It is completely open world and the map is quite large. It has quite a few different environments, enough to fill your desire for fantasy.

Why I like it:
1. It's an easy going game
2. It's well embedded in the fantasy genre
3. The combat is satisfying albeit a bit janky at times, but it's what I call reactive & live combat (swing each time you press)
4. There are different combat styles and magic to unlock and experiment with
5. Alchemy is completely open and you can create a potion out of any natural ingredient
6. The world is nicely designed and interesting
7. There is fast travel but it's restricted to specific portals you've unlocked
8. It has a nice equipment levelling feature (combine 2 of the same item to level it up)

The flaws I mentioned before are as follows:
1. Dialogue doesn't seem natural at all
2. Quite a few bugs with quests - sometimes they don't complete or complete automatically
3. The ending is very disappointing
4. It's not a massively immersive story (probably due to its length & voice acting)
5. There's not an awful lot to do aside from quests and combat
6. There's no controller support - I had to use a plugin (preferred controller as I started on Xbox)

These I imagine are quite representative of the game's age. But I think it's aged well for the game that it is. I would return to play it again. The only thing holding me back from doing so is the ending:
SPOILER:

The ending basically stops the game completely and the only way to carry on playing is to load a previous save and not do the final quest. I find this quite irritating especially if you want to do side quests or have a sense of 'full completion'. It just seems a bit strange to abruptly end the game completely.

I loved this game and single player is ok, but multiplayer have some realy hard bugs! Then we lost everything we get in hours of playtime and the charakters are stucked on this lvl with the items he had in the moment of this lvl in the inventory, witch makes multiplayer unplayable.... The second hard bug is, that every chest is a master chest if your lvl is high enough (around lvl 35+) and you cant open them the most time. That makes no fun and this bugs will never be fixed....

Довольно интересная смесь средневековья, магии и порчи. Из плюсов: огромная карта с множеством персонажей, животных и нечисти. Большой выбор оружия и доспехов, которые можно крафтить, улучшая их характеристики. Неплохой сюжет. Игра понравилась, рекомендую.
Only in this game when you wear heavy armor, you able to walk under the water...

Schöne offene Welt und klare Queststrukturen. Man kann die vorgegebenen Wege auch verlassen und die Umgebung erkunden. Equipment lässt sich im Spielverlauf auch sehr gut finden. Der einzige negative Punkt ist,  leider lässt sich der Schwierigkeitsgrad nur am Anfang einstellen, wenn man ein neues Spiel beginnt.

Ursprünglich hatte ich mir Two Worlds gekauft, um einen Blick darauf zu werfen, ob es so schlecht ist, wie schon gemunkelt wurde... Und auch wenn es nicht furchtbar ist, kann ich es nicht empfehlen! Ausführliche Review folgt.

1. GRAFIK
Die Grafik präsentiert sich solide und sieht auch für heutige Standards noch ziemlich gut aus. Die Welt sah schön aus und ich bin gerne umher gelaufen.  zumindest dort, wo die Umgebung fertig gestellt wurde von den Entwicklern.... Nur wirkte die Umgebung oftmals ein bisschen riesig für den Charakter. Außerdem wirkt die Grafik etwas "krisselig" und die Auflösung ist leider gefühlt sehr niedrig.... 

Rating: 3/5

2. STORY
Die Story von Two Worlds fand ich ganz interessant und war positiv überrascht! Es handelt sich zwar um nichts unglaublich Innovatives, aber es gab auch schon alles unter der Sonne. Die Präsentation der Geschichte war auch hier ziemlich solide und glaubhaft. Zumindest der Anfang war vielversprechend für mich.

Rating: 3/5

3. NPCs
Leider nicht wirklich allzu bemerkenswert. Ich erinnere mich an niemand mehr, der irgendwie vorkam. Außer an die Schwester des Protagonisten, die aber abwesend ist erstmal.

Rating: 1/5

4. GAMEPLAY
Das Gameplay in Two Worlds ist leider furchtbar. Es fühlt sich so an, als wäre alles unglaublich umständlich gelöst worden und wäre so viel einfacher gegangen. Das Spiel kam mir stellenweise unspielbar vor allein wegen der Steuerung! Ganz zu schweigen von Quests, die man nicht lösen kann, weil sie so verbuggt sind...

Rating: 1/5

5. WIEDERSPIELWERT
Geht leider gegen Null, obwohl man sehr viel Freiheit dabei hat, wie man seinen Protagonisten gestaltet! Aber die Steuerung hat mich leider komplett vergrault. Ich kam leider nie so weit, um beurteilen zu können, ob es irgendwelche Entscheidungen oder irgendetwas gibt, dass den Wiederspielwert steigert....

Rating: 1/5

Two Worlds ist mit 9 von 25 Punkten doch ziemlich im unteren Bereich. Das Spiel hat zwar Potenzial und sicher seine Liebhaber, aber es ist ganz sicher nicht für jeden etwas.
Stará grafika, ale zábavná hratelnost. Obrovský otevřený svět bez omezení. Kouzla, lektvary, zbroje co si kombinujete a vylepšujete. Opravdové RPG.

Absolutely solid oldschool RPG featuring nearly every mechanic and gimmick that a fantasy setting requires. The world is huge, beautiful and got a lot of things to discover, including various bioms, cities, factions/races, bandit camps etc. Gothic 3 is a worthy comparison in that aspect. The Lore is pretty immersive, RealityPump created something very own here. Main and Side Quests are okayish, some are excellent, others are boring, most offer choices with consequences. The Main Quests leads the player into nearly every corner of the world which connects you to various side quests and so on...
The typical Two Worlds Engine is as genius as in the second game, easily understandable but still complex enough to create one of the best Character Progression Systems ever (TW2->TW1 but still top tier). There are nearly zero tutorials or tips thus its about the player himself to learn how the game is working. Really Really enjoying this game as an oldschool RPG Fanboy. Although be careful before buying TWEE; Animations are being displayed in a very low FPS rate which can not be improved nor fixed which CAN be hurting to watch and/or cause sickness.

I played this so much on xbox 360 back in the day, and it's still one of my favorite games.  I'll come back and play through it at least once a year.  That being said, it has some issues that make me see why people don't like it.  

The voice acting is hilariously bad, but I find it charming.  Just don't take it too seriously and learn to laugh at how silly they sound.  Combat is simplistic, but it can be entertaining if you don't just dodge spam.  Every enemy can be cheesed hard with the dodge mechanic, so it can be hard not to default to that.  As simple as the magic system is, I love it.  Upgrading weapons is simple but rewarding. I see people mention bugs a lot, but I've never encountered anything game breaking.  The main story isn't the best, especially early on, but the side stories and factions provide lots of entertainment.

 I strongly suggest trying this game if you enjoy any type of hack and slash rpg fantasy games.  It's nothing groundbreaking, but it is original and worth a try.

Trotz all dem finde ich es immer noch ein gut gelungenes Spiel. Was macht denn ein Spiel für jeden von uns Persönlich aus? Die lust es immer wieder zu spielen und das ist bei mir hier Definitv der Fall.

[h1]It's fun enough to keep you engaged, until it's not.[/h1]

[b]TL:DR[/b]: It's a fun game with some interesting mechanics and I ultimately enjoyed the time I had despite some glaring issues. Get it on sale with managed expectations and you should have a good time. Plus once you get bored you can just burn the main quest line in like two hours to finish the game. 

[b][u]Pros[/u][/b]
[b]Items[/b]: The available items and weapons in this game are great. Some are just re-hashed gear with different color schemes but overall there is a large variety of weapons and armor to choose from. Another thing that was great is the fact that they [b]actually have pole-arms and spears.[/b] I've played countless RPGs and that always seems to be a weapon set that's left out so it was great to seem them included. 
[b]Gear Improvement[/b]: Admittedly this took me a while to figure out, but once I did it opened up a whole new aspect of leveling my gear to insane stats. It allows you to simply drag and drop identical gear on top of each other to improve their stats, which you will find more than enough of since money and equipment are not hard to come by.
[b]Magic[/b]: The magic system is pretty interesting as well, as it allows you to stack spells (similar to gear) and gain spell booster which add various enhancements like duration damage etc.
[b]Progression[/b]: You will always feel like you are progressing and gaining more abilities which is a nice touch.
[b]Mounts[/b]: There are a variety of horse based mounts throughout the game which provide greater inventory space and speed up long distance travel.
[b]Fast Travel[/b]: There are portals scattered throughout the game as well as mobile portals the player carries which are extremely useful and awesome to have. This way you can pop in and out of dungeons without spend minutes or hours just back tracking.

[b][u]Other[/u][/b]
[b]Mounts[/b]: As I said there are mounts but they are pretty janky to control. Numerous times I would mount up for my horse to glide along some invisible wall out in the open or absolutely refuse to turn a direction and in some instances just steer wherever they wanted. It's a minor nuisance but not a deal breaker. 
[b]Story[/b]: The story is a bland affair: your sister is kidnapped you want to save your sister....pretty much sums it up.
[b]Side Quests[/b]: Mostly boring if I'm honest. Most drum down to you're a mercenary so you do a lot of fetch/kill quests that have little if nothing to do with the story line. 

[b][u]Cons[/u][/b]
[b]Beginning & End[/b]: Absolute weirdest start/finish to a game I've ever experienced. I had no idea what was happening when I started the game. There is no introduction what so ever. You're literally just thrown into the game with no clue what the story is or what you are doing. I didn't really find out what the story was until like an hour or so into the game because it never tells you until you start the main quest line. The game ends just as a abruptly. There is no ending you defeat the final boss and immediately load to the menu....weird as hell.
[b]Spells[/b]: Certain skills/spells just don't work. This mainly seems to apply to magic that aims to immobilize targets that just do nothing. The animation will play but the actual spell does nothing. 
[b]Skills[/b]: I played melee with some magic abilities, think Death Knight, but I found a lot of the melee skills to be almost pointless. Many of the animation are extremely slow so it's quite difficult to pull off the melee abilities without getting hit out of the animation. Additionally, many of them are geared to single target encounters which is rare to come across, I can probably count every encounter involving a single enemy on one hand. 
[b]Weird Dialogue[/b]: There were times where I went to a new location, talked to someone for a quest just to get some weird interaction as if I already knew the person or person they were talking about which will throw you off. You can jump parts of a quest or outright screw it up by doing stuff out of order which really defeats the purpose of an open world RPG.

This game is bad. It was bad when it came out and it still bad. However that didn't stop me from putting in 100 hours+ on the xbox. The game is buggy beyond anything I have ever played However if you can look past all of the flaws it is a ton of fun and has a lot of charm. It is especially fun when you play with your friends. But if you can't look past annoying basic bugs then don't waste your time. There are better games. I just like this game for the nostalgia

This game is like if asylum films made an RPG. its story is garbage is battle system need some serious work and the voice acting is HYSTERICAL! It has pieces of the map that were never finished, i believe there is a quest that is unbeatable cuz the developers didnt finish it. i love it so much, if you like rpgs and wanna play one that feels like it was made by a ten year old who played alot of oblivion then this is for you!

If you enjoy old school RPGs with simple hack and slash mechanics and magic, this game is definitely for you. There is a lot of freedom to build your character however you want. Want to run around in wizard robes with a two hander and summon spiders? Go for it. Want to shoot lightning bolts while using a bow and arrow naked on the back of a horse? You got it. Do what you want, how you want. The story seems rather difficult to follow and the controls can be somewhat clunky, but overall I'd say the game is really fun. I believe I bought it for $2 or $3 during a sale. If you can get it for a low price, don't mind watered down graphics, and sub-par voice acting, I highly recommend purchasing it and giving the game a chance. It's an interesting play through and I've really enjoyed it. Just don't expect to be getting GOTY gameplay or AAA title performance.

I have played this game from start to finish, and I cannot recommend this game unless you are a massive fan of the old-school RPG genre.
To summarise this game in one word: Disappointing.

Where do I even begin?
The awful voice acting, the out of place sound track, the mindless combat, the clunky UI.

Many aspects of this game just make no design sense.
For example: Let's provide the players with a map of the region and show them all the roads and routes so they can see the possibilities and provide a sense of adventure!
At the same time: Let's make their mini-map black and be filled in as they explore!

Some aspects are just simply incomplete. I'm looking at you "Unhorsing Strike", an attack that allows you to knock opponents off their horses. What are shame THERE ARE NO MOUNTED ENEMIES!

To top it off, the ending is anti-climatic and not worth the effort put into finishing the game.

If it sounds like you could over look these rough edges then by all means give this game a try, but prepare to be disappointed.
And at least buy it when it's on sale.

Great adventure in Gothic way made. We have huge world full of enemies and chests, quests. Grand adventure in Antaloor of one guy that just want to save his sister. While traveling through the game you will encounter new teleports, caves, villages and these travels are recorded in-game mini-map. Teleports allow rapid travel between explored regions. Horses are available to ride as well as other animals or creatures.

There is no set storyline to follow, we are free to choose to complete the quests of our liking, and explore at will. May choose to act as a righteous hero and be honored amongst the population, or to be delightfully devilish, through reputation gained by completing certain quests. Path chosen will have consequences on the outcome of the game.

Many items and skills to choice by the way. Alchemy to help us or magic. There is quiet of many ways to go on.

it's an old school RPG with some fun features, decent story and tons of things to kill
